Description: Rock crystal fourteen-sided bead in the form of a pentagondodekahedra dice. A hole is pierced through two of the larger faces.
Curator's comments: Common Roman period 'truncated cubic bead' often in glass, copying a cut gem of rock crystal or a pentagondodekahedra dice (Xia 2014, 140, 154, 169, PL.III, GN77). This example is pierced, without markings on the facets that would be expected with a pentagondodekahedra dice.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (3995)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TH.01)
